Dialogues.DialogueText: Wow, is the place people here call Glasgow?
Yes, the geographical features match with the provided map so this should be it.
Good, that should be the river Clyde at the far side… and that… should be the site of the Glasgow Cathedral.
Looks like it.
Looking at the mission description, it seems like we should gather information about the missing materials meant for the cathedral.
Nice! Nexus, activate the translation device and the appearance modifier unit, set mode: auto.
Translation And Disguise Protocols Engaged.
Deployment Mode: Auto.
Explore and talk to the 3 NPCs
Good morning, sir, we’re looking for missing materials needed for the cathedral construction. Have you seen anything unusual?
Materials, ye say?
What materials ye talking bout?
Can’t ya see that I’m busy with the smithy? Got iron to shape and no time for daft tales.
Sorry to bother you, we’re just passing merchants.
Arrived here yesterday and heard some carts vanished near the kirk. Thought that someone local might know something about it.
Ah, those. Don’t concern myself with that, but folks say that the stuff always disappears at night.
Speak with the priests if ya want more and come buy yourselves a hammer if ya ever need one.
Might help ya two build a wee cottage to settle down, eh?
Haha… thanks. We’ll think about it.
Thank you for the info, have a nice day.
Well, that got a bit awkward, didn’t it?
What did?
Ugh, never mind. Let’s go find the priest.
ok.
Good afternoon, Father. We are passing merchants who overheard about the missing cathedral materials.
We were told that you might know something more about them.
Ah, yes. I’ve been awaiting you.
Wait, did you know we were coming?
Yes, of course. It’s as the Lord foretold.
Fascinating, is this something akin to the Nous Entropía…
Did you say something, o traveller?
Don’t mind him.
As we were saying, we were told that you would know more about the missing materials for the cathedral.
Why, of course. I have kept account of such matters.
Most of the disappearances happen to the materials on the burn’s side.
I have set watchmen there, yet they see naught. It is almost as if it were the work of phantoms.
Alas, it must be the Lord’s will.
Seems like the clues point to the nearby Molendinar burn.
Yeah, seems like the general direction.
Let’s go
One more thing, I was told to deliver the message: 'The brightest light casts the darkest shadows; let not old truths blind your sight.'
Now, may the Lord bless your journey.
Thank you, Father!
Hey, what did he mean by those last words?
Pay them no mind, it is probably some nonsensical superstition.
Remember, as the Empire taught us - 'None possess wisdom greater than His Majesty the Emperor'.
To trust any truth beyond his knowledge is heresy, and to oppose his vision is treason.
I know, I know.
His Majesty is like a ray of hope to the people of the Empire.
After all, he overthrew the old tyrant 300 years ago and made the Empire as prosperous as it is today.
And… He even gave us two a chance…
Sorry, I got carried away…
Take your time, we can proceed after a break.
Oh, look, there’s still someone up this late, and by the burn…
Seems suspicious…
Let’s go check it out.
Hey!
AAAAAH!!!
The monsters!
Nexus, check disguise protocol!
Disguise Protocol Active
BOTH OF YOU CALM DOWN!
Ahhh… It was just a young couple, whew.
What are ye young people doing roaming so late at night?
That’s what we wanted to ask you.
We heard that the recent cathedral material disappearances all happened around the burn side so we decided to check it out.
Most people should be asleep by now so we thought that you looked suspicious.
Suspicious, ye say?!
I’m just guarding what’s mine.
Each night, there’s a foul screech by the old cross.
Every time, my livestock go crazy- barn in ruin, some even drop dead where they stand.
Foul screech?
Yes, last eve, I went to seek out the cause, and I swear by Saint Mungo, I saw demons.
Skin red as rotten blood, ears sharp as blades, and a cursed orb circling their crowns.
I told the watch but they looked at me like I was crazy.
So here I am, with my trusty hoe, ready to deal with them myself.
I’m sure you’d do good with that hoe, but what about you go back for tonight.
We are here on behalf of the Father to take care of the demons.
Really?!
Thank Lord, they actually sent someone!
I can finally sleep easy now.
Rest assured, and may the Lord’s blessings be with you!
That was nice thinking, using the Father as an excuse.
What, you think I’m that oblivious?
From how clueless you are sometimes…
You were saying?
Never mind.
Looking at what he just said, it seems like the culprits fit the description of the criminals we’re after.
Yes, let’s head over and wait in ambush.
Nice, seems like we’ll be completing both missions at once!
There they are!
Nexus, activate interference device!
Interference Field Cast
Nice, they shouldn’t be able to escape now.
Now, get them!
Oh no, the Imperials!
Quick, activate the escape sequence!
It’s not working, they cast an interference barrier.
Curses, activate emergency protocol!
Emergency Protocol Activating in 3…
Don’t let them get away!
Unleashing annihilation program.
No, we need them alive.
Ahh…
Nexus, switch to tracking…
Understood, Tracker Implanted…
Forwarding Timeline
Sorry, I panicked.
We couldn’t catch them but at least we got their next location
They shouldn’t notice anytime soon so we can first complete the primary objective.
Yeah…
Let’s go…
Pick up something (tree root or stone) to see stolen materials and floating device on top
This should be all the materials.
Yup, nice work.
Wait, look up!
Is that a core fragment?!
Yes, looks like one!
Seems like they sacrificed this fragment to make the jump.
We might find some clues from it!
Good, Nexus, activate the illusion formation
Activating Illusion Formation
No one should bother us now.
Platform parkour (2-player so one must do something for the other to advance and so on…)

Consider giving different mechanics to each player: one can jump higher but cannot pick up big objects; the other can carry big objects but has lower jumps. Use pressure plates so players alternate to progress.
Example: Player1 stands on pressure plate to raise platform for Player2; Player2 stands on next plate to raise Player1, etc. Floating sci-fi platforms are acceptable.
We got it!
Good work!
Nexus, send this to the ship for repair and analysis.
Transporting Core Fragment
Can’t wait to see what juicy information this gives us~
You seem very excited.
Of course, it’s only our first dispatch and we’re already doing so much~
Do want to go back and rest tho.
Save that for after the mission.
Sure, sure.
Let’s get the materials back first I guess.
I’ve been expecting you two.
Again?!
Indeed. The Lord has notified me of your visit.
I trust you two have the materials.
Yes, we’ve retrieved all of them.
Blessed be. As a token of gratitude, shall I bestow the Lord’s blessing upon you both?
Ye…
No thank you, we’ll be taking our leave.
Very well, I shall await your return when the cathedral opens its doors again on a fateful day five decades from now.
You idiot!
Are you talking about the blessings?
How did you know?
You know very well that we should not receive any blessings from anyone other than His Majesty the Emperor.
But no one will know…
Argh, fine.
Let’s check the location tracker we put on the revolutionaries.
Temporal coordinates are… 1189, 53 years from now.
Looking back, I didn’t hear properly, but didn’t the priest mention something about meeting us five decades later?
He speaks like he knows everything, it’s almost disturbing.
It does seem too precise to just be a baseless superstition.
He does seem like a nice guy though.
Nevermind, let’s quickly head to the target location, lest we lose the criminals again.
